fields.summary: Ranking issues only possible if customFieldId for Rank field is available

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I get message stating that done Epics are not part of any boards.
But when I go to boards, I know cntained the epic, I can access the Epic report trough the report tab.

I would expect epics to function the same way as other issues. Other closed issues, I can still use View on Board, it just takes me to Sprint report.

I would expect to be able to access Epic report for Done epics.
fields.summary: As a User, I want the View on Board link on an Epic issue to link to the Epic report for Done Epics.

fields.summary: After update to Agile 6.3.2 plugin is not working

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

After upgrading to JIRA Agile 6.3.2, users face this message :

bq. JIRA Agile is currently unavailable. This might be because an upgrade task has failed to run or has not not yet completed.
Please contact your system administrator if you continue to see this message.

The following stack trace will also appear in the logs :

{code}
2013-09-26 20:00:17,911 pool-103-thread-1 ERROR admin 1198x2390x3 et6e7x 10.60.2.87 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [sal.core.upgrade.PluginUpgrader] Upgrade failed: com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.fields.NotSupported cannot be cast to com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.fields.CustomIssueField
java.lang.ClassCastException: com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.fields.NotSupported cannot be cast to com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.fields.CustomIssueField
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.issue.DefaultFieldsServiceImpl.getBusinessValueCustomField(DefaultFieldsServiceImpl.java:62)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.upgrade.GhUpgradeTask040.updateBusinessValueField(GhUpgradeTask040.java:317)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.upgrade.GhUpgradeTask040.performUpgrade(GhUpgradeTask040.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.upgrade.AbstractGhUpgradeTask.doUpgrade(AbstractGhUpgradeTask.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)  <+2> (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
{code}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Using a version of JIRA Agile prior to 6.3.2, delete the 'Business Value' custom field
# Update your JIRA Agile to version 6.3.2
# Once done, head to your dashboard (or any other pages), and you will face the error

h1. *Workaround*

A workaround has been found, and the steps required for this can be found here - [Upgrade to JIRA Agile 6.3.2 breaks JIRA Agile|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Upgrading+to+JIRA+Agile+6.3.2+breaks+JIRA+Agile]
fields.summary: Upgrade to JIRA Agile 6.3.2 breaks the application

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a  scrum master I want to be able to have full control over the order in which fields are displayed in the RapidBoards "Issue Detail View" so that we can surface information on an order that is more relevant to our team, not the way determined by Atlassian.

In this context, we have a custom field called BDD scenarios and we'd like to display this BENEATH the description field, but there is no way of moving these around. This is one example obviously. Ideally we'd actually want all of this information to be displayed in the order we want and way above the General Fields information, for us that isn't as relevant as the Description and BDD scenarios but we they are useful enough to have them available in this view.
fields.summary: Full control over field order in Issue Detail View

fields.description:
When viewing my issues in the Plan mode, I can currently group them by Version or Epic.

I would like to be able view issues by label too, since we use labels to store attributes about our JIRA issues (e.g. 'performance', 'ux', etc.).  Currently I must use epics instead of labels in order to group issues within the planning board, so we are overloading the meaning of an epic.

fields.description: In the planning board, clicking on an epic at the left of the screen causes the backlog to be filtered for issues that fall under that epic. There is however no way to filter for issues that fall under one of several epics. This should be possible by standard multi-selection (shift-click, ctrl-click),

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
(This applies to the Scrum board's burndown chart.)

When someone logs work and makes a huge mistake with the remaining estimate - e.g., entering days instead of hours (due to the default time unit) -, the burndown chart's remaining estimates line will show a spike. When correcting the mistake by editing the work log entry and fixing the remaining estimate, the spike should be removed, but it is not. For an example, see the attached file "burndown.png" and for the culprit, see "logged hours.png".

These spikes can get so high that the burndown chart is no longer readable, see "burndown2.png".
fields.summary: Spikes in remaining estimate are not removed from Burndown Chart even when remaining estimate is corrected

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I want several columns in the rapid board - one that indicate status like "Pending approval", one for "Lined up", then the normal one for "in progress", and new ones for "peer review", "qa review" and "done".

Both "Pending approval" and "Lined up" should be red. (TO DO)

"In progress", "peer review" and "qa review" should be yellow. (IN PROGRESS)

"Done" should be green. (DONE)

(Originally: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/215783/can-i-change-the-color-of-the-columns-in-the-rapid-board)
fields.summary: As a user I would like to have several columns in the Rapid Board as counting as "TO DO"

fields.summary: Add fields to cards on scrum/kanban boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The symptom here is if you add an issue to a future sprint, then resolve it, then start the sprint, the issue appears in the sprint on Work Mode and Sprint Report/Burndown Chart.

There is a mild inconsistency with the reporting of the estimate value between Sprint Report and Burndown Chart. The Burndown Chart shows the issue coming into the sprint with a value of 0, regardless of the actual estimate. This is because the issue was already 'burnt down' before the sprint started. The Sprint Report on the other hand, shows the value of the estimate when the sprint started, which may be non-zero.

Therefore the fix here may be around making the reporting more consistent/accurate, or it may be around not bringing such issues into the sprint in the first place. The latter could be difficult to solve due to issues potentially appearing on multiple boards.
fields.summary: Issues which are added to a future sprint and resolved before the sprint is started still appear in the sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi, 
We find both hours burndown chart and story points burndown chart very useful and we would like all team members to have access to those  We have noticed that we need to give every employee an admin access so they can go in the configuration to switch from one burndown chart to the other. Is it possible that people without admin right can switch from one burndown chart to the other into one click only, without having to access the configuration board exclusive to the Admin?
Thank you in advance for you answer.
fields.summary: Access to both burndown hours chart and story points burndown chart to all users not just admin

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Open Create Issue dialog
# Enter an Epic Link for the issue
# Check Create Another and then submit
# Observe that the Epic Link field is empty
# Try to create a second issue

h4. Expected

Epic Link should be re-populated with the same epic as the first issue, submit should work.

h4. Actual

Epic Link field is not populated, and submit returns error: "Epic with key '' does not exist."
fields.summary: Epic link isn't copied when using Create Another to create multiple issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
TL;DR: It can be non trivial to get a list of unique projects which are returned by a given JQL query. If we list these out, then admins will be better able to troubleshoot permissions issues.

From a support ticket:

{code}The Agile Board will not allow you to create a sprint if you don't have appropriate permissions for all the projects covered by the board's filter. Unfortunately people sometimes inadvertently include a project through using links as part of their query, or where someone has been assigned some small task in another project. There could be just a couple of tasks from that project in the filter of hundreds of issues and this can be hard to find.

It would be great if on the Agile Board->Configuration->Filter screen you could show the list of projects that are being picked up by the current filter.

Often I get scrum masters asking me why the create sprint button is not working for them after they have created a new board or modified a filter. It was working before and now it isn't and they and I can't see why.

Also the Version Report can also have trouble when unexpected tasks appear in the filter (e.g. a task from another project but without its parent story).

Having a simple list of projects would be a very useful hint as to where there could be a problem. If there are any unexpected projects then that will be a great pointer.{code}
fields.summary: As a board administrator, I want to see a list of projects associated with a board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-9846].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce:

- Go to [Projects] -> [Create Project]  - > [Agile Scrum] -> [Next]
- If you don't have JIRA Agile, it will suggest you to trial it as per the below screenshot:

!tryagile.png!

- Click on (try for free), and nothing happens.

h5. Expected behavior:

To add a trial version of JIRA Agile to JIRA.

fields.description:
*+Current Behavior:+*
Currently, the *JIRA Agile Days Remaining in Sprint* gadget shows the days remaining as 0 during the last day of the sprint. 

+*Situation:*+
For example, I have a sprint that ends on Tuesday. Although Tuesday is technically the last day of the sprint, the developers still have all day to complete their work. Therefore, there should never be a count of zero days left as that implies it is the start of the next sprint.

The thought process behind the current behavior is that, technically at the end of Tuesday there is no time left in the sprint, so therefore there are zero days remaining then. 

+*Solution Suggested:*+
To avoid this, a potential fix could be updating the gadget to change to an hourly scale on the last day of the sprint. As time passes on the last day, devs will get a clear indication of how much time is left.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile user, I'd like to display the Days Remaining in Sprint gadget in an hourly scale

fields.description:
h4. Summary 
Earlier today I learned that non-working days is registered per board in Jira Agile instead of in one place as it was with Greenhopper (https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/212326/how-does-jira-agile-consider-non-working-days). 
We have several boards, and this basically means that I have to register the same X number of non-working days on every board we have in Jira around new years every year. 
It would be great to have the possibility to copy these days from one board to another (or perhaps have a general configuration for this that will be adopted for all boards by default), just to remove the work and the possibility of loosing out on one/picking the wrong one, etc.

h4. Workaround
(i) Tested in JIRA Agile 6.7.0
Use the following REST call:
{code}POST http://<jira-baseurl>/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviewconfig/workingdays/nonworkingday/add{code}
With the following JSON data:
{code}{"rapidViewId":2,"iso8601Date":"2015-05-31"}{code}
Where rapidViewId is the ID of the Scrum board, and iso8601Date is date to be added. 
Taken from [Paul's comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-9833?focusedCommentId=720812&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-720812].
fields.summary: As a user I want to set non-working days for multiple boards at once

As a SE I get a lot of customers not aware of the best practices for using sub-tasks in SCRUM. This subsequently causes a lot of problems for users going from classic to rapid boards as a lot of the way things are handled in the new versions are different. We have some fantastic general docs in https://www.atlassian.com/agile/ - can you please expand this to have information about best practices on sub-tasks?

For example, expanding on:

# Create your user stories (aka tasks). Drag them and drop to the right version in the planning board.
# Create sub-tasks for them with your estimates.
# Add the stories to the sprint.
# Complete the sprint - any sub-tasks that are not completed will continue to be tracked on the story (the parent) when it's returned back to the backlog after the sprint is complete.
# The completed sub-tasks can be tracked with the Burndown chart.
# If there are further sub-tasks to be completed, they can be scheduled in the next sprint when the story is added to it.

fields.description:
Hello,

I ran into an interesting situation which I do NOT have an explanation for. I had some co-workers setup a Rapid Board. They had two active sprints going on, one right after the other. (e.g. September 1 to September 7 for Sprint 1 and September 8 to September 15 for Sprint 2). What was going on was that they were trying to change the Sprint number on the issues from 2 to 1 or 1 to 2. Vise Versa and the Sprint field was marking on the issue "Extended Sprint". When they input the sprintid number (e.g. 73) they got it back to saying Sprint 2 otherwise just putting a two in put it back to Extended Sprint. They completed the first Sprint and these items still occurred.

The information I am trying to achieve is the following:

1. What causes the issue to display in the Sprint Field "EXTENDED SPRINT"?
2. Why would you need to put in the sprintid number (e.g. 73) to get the correct sprint number to display instead of just putting a 2 or 1 when your sprint is named "Sprint 2 or Sprint 1"?
3. What are some pointers to avoid in the future to avoid this happening again?

Anyways, any information on this would be much appreciated. Thank you
fields.summary: Request Information: I change Sprint number on issue and it displays "Extended Sprint"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When changing certain aspects of sprints, including closing them, notifications are sent to all people involved in the sprint. The project 'Notification Scheme' does not allow a SCRUM Master / Project Administrator to tailor which specific notifications people involved in the project receive. Having additional notification options that are specific to sprints would be a great addition to the already extensive list of notification events within the project 'Notification Scheme'

Options like:

- Send emails on Sprint Start
- Send emails on Sprint Close
- Send emails when issues change rank

These would be of great use during sprint planning

h3. Environment
Server
Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a sprint
# Add issues to your sprint
# Move several issues to a closed / completed state
# End the sprint
# Perform any other combination of sprint related events that generate notifications. i.e., Rank changing


h3. Expected Results
Notifications should be sent to only the people that have been placed in specific notification events


h3. Actual Results
All people involved in a sprint are sent the same notifications

 
h3. Notes
The current set of notification events within Notification Schemes, does not include any Sprint specific notification events.

Problem is in BurndownUtils#addSprintHistoryChanges method. The code makes the assumption that the first change the sprint custom field value of an issue is setting the value to a sprint, not removing it, as is the case with the cloned issue. This causes the the cloned issue to be counted as being part of the sprint, while it was not.

fields.description:
Hello,

In the current JIRA Agile plugin you need to be project admin of all the participating projects of a sprint to start the sprint (also to create a new sprint).

For our organization this isn't suitable; any developer needs to have the permission to create a sprint and/or to start a sprint. 
However, giving every developer the project administrator permission to every project that may participate in a sprint isn't the best solution either; project specific settings may be modified which is something that we want to prevent.

What I would like to have is a specific permission (that can be assigned) that allows the user to create and/or start a sprint. 

Is this something that can be realized? 
It's something that is giving us headaches for quite some time now :-)

Kind regards,
Koen Werdler, EsperantoXL
fields.summary: Create a seperate permission / role for creating / starting a sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Using a project that has active sprints, generate a Project Pivot Report that has "Sprint" selected as an additional column.

Instead of what I assume is meant to be the sprint name, you end up with a whole lot of text like this:

{code}com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.Sprint@2a7bf9[rapidViewId=119,state=FUTURE,name=Sprint 1,startDate=<null>,endDate=<null>,completeDate=<null>,id=97]{code}
fields.summary: "Sprint" column in Project Pivot Report doesn't show sprint name but "com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.Sprint..."

fields.summary: Cloning an issue is throwing a null pointer exception

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We are currently using the the JIra Agile/Greenhopper for our project tracking. We have gone through multiple sprints, and have continuously noticed that our sprint burndown reports are innacurate.  When adding up the hours remaining that are on our board vs the hours remaining in the burndown charts. They do not match up. The numbers we are also seeing between our manual additions, the widget burndown and the burndown via the board report. Are all different.  We have reviewed work logs and are unable to pin point any innacurracy there.  We have been trying different filters, etc. With no success.  We are always having additional hours show up in our burndowns that are not a true representation of our remaining hours.  Is there any known bugs in our version of Jira/Agile?  

We have also read through the documentation to make sure are setups are correct. Any follow up would be appreciated.
fields.summary: Classic Agile Burndown and Report Burndown not showing accurate data

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have configured a board with swimlanes based on fixVersion. In some cases, tickets are common to different products and therefore have more than one fixVersion. We would like the option to see in each of the swim lanes, instead of just the first one.
fields.summary: As a product owner, I would like to be able to see a ticket in multiple Kanban swim lanes.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We only add estimates to subtasks, and not to both subtasks and parent tasks (stories.) This helps us avoid double counting of issue totals on Jira reports and pages. Unfortunately, there isn't a good way to group changes outside of an issue type such as epics or subtasks. 

The Jira issue page has an option to include subtasks when seeing the original estimate. This would be helpful on the Details View while using the Agile boards. My stories with subtask estimates are showing 0 under the Estimate field; however, they are showing xx hours under the Remaining field. So, it's misleading that the "Estimate" field only shows the estimate for the main task or story; however, the "Remaining" shows the total remaining for subtasks as well.
fields.summary: Jira Agile should show the subtask total with the Estimate field in the Details View

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
For example, if a board has Original Estimate configured as the estimation statistic, and then the global "Time Tracking" feature is disabled in JIRA, then you get the error shown in the screenshot.

We should consider gracefully falling back to Issue Count statistic, with a less harsh warning message.
fields.summary: When estimation statistic is no longer valid, Plan Mode does not load and an error message is shown

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We currently have our docs organized as follows:
- JIRA Agile 6.3
- GreenHopper 6.2
- GreenHopper 6.1

and so on. However, the link to the GreenHopper 6.2 documentation in the [JIRA Agile Documentation Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ALLDOC/JIRA+Agile+Documentation+Directory] is broken. 

It actually seems there is no GreenHopper 6.2 documentation, as https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH is redirected to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE and https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH62 does not exist.
fields.summary: The GreenHopper 6.2 documentation is broken

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Ubuntu's default screenshot name is something like "Screenshot from 2013-09-04 10:18:05.png", which is not accepted by the "Attachment" feature. This slows down development and requires users to rename the screenshot before attaching it. Can the file name simply be sanitized on the back-end?
fields.summary: Attachment filename format restrictions slow down development

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

fields.summary: Internal Server Error while accessing Planning Mode due to com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.plan.PlanningModeServiceImpl.getProgressIndicators

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Project Manager I need to change the sequence of my planned Sprints in the Plan-Mode of the Scrum Board.

This is really important for me because I wish to create sprints in the far future and break them down to smaller planned sprints when time goes on.

i.e:

    Sprint KW1-KW2 2014
    Sprint KW3-KW4 2014
    Sprint February 2014
    Sprint March 2014
    Sprint Quartal 2 2014
    Sprint Quartal 3 2014
    Sprint Quartal 4 2014

Many of the customers of //SEIBERT/MEDIA wish to have this feature in order to be able to plan the tasks continuously - as a rolling plan. I would love to have this feature as well. I really hope that you are going to implement it in the near future because it allows project manager to use the agile board even for the more "classic" project management which still many of our customers love. Even for the Agile Planning this feature would bring a lot of advantages.

Please don't hesitate to contact me for any questions. I would really love to see this feature!

Cheers
Björn Frauen
fields.summary: As a Project Manager I need to change the sequence of my planned Sprints in the Plan-Mode of the Scrum Board.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Creating a sprint requires to have administer project on all projects that have issues in the board's backlog. 
Unfortunately, this requirement also includes epics. 
This limits users to only filtering by epics in their projects. If their stories belong to epics from other projects, they have to chose between being able to use the epics panel or being able to create sprints.
fields.summary: Cross project epics prevent from creating sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Add an ability to add validation actions for items that enter sprints or when sprints begin. 

Examples:

* A story cannot be added to a sprint (active or planned) unless the ticket has an assignee
* Cannot add to sprint or start sprint until all items in sprint are estimated
* Cannot start sprint without having all issues have assignees
fields.summary: Sprint Validation actions

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When using the Detail View, vertical space is consumed by custom fields that have no data to display for the issue being viewed. Omitting these fields would be a great way to reclaim vertical space.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I would like empty fields to be omitted from the Detail View

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# install JIRA Agile 6.3.0.2
# create Kanban/Scrum board
# Configure board -> Columns > mouse hover the Done's checkbox as per screenshot Error.png > the message in the hint is missing and the "undefined" is shown

This is not reproducible in JIRA Agile 6.2.5.1 as per screenshot Correct.png
fields.summary: Hint is missing from the checkbox in the Columns configuration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be great if we can have an option to define a flag in the issues on the board which changes according to the estimated Story Point x actual value.
If the issue exceeds it's estimate Story Point, it changes the flag color.
fields.summary: Change the flag based in Story Points

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When working in a Agile Board, you can select quick filters previously created, if you select more than one quick filter, it will always add to the previous one like: assignee = rcarracedo and type = bug it will show issues that have the rcarracedo assignee and the issue type bug. But if you select two filters: type = bug and type = task, it will show no results, because the issue type can't be both bug and task at the same time.

Customer would like to have the option to change between the "AND" and "OR" operators implicit when selecting more than one quick filter.
fields.summary: Ability to change between "AND" or "OR" in quick filters

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
JIRA Admins are being confused by the [JIRA Agile 6.3 Upgrade notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+6.3+Upgrade+Notes] because they don't find the documented message: "JIRA Agile has an upgrade available" on the Manage Add-ons page. 

Also, when they see that Greenhopper shows under the available updates, they are hesitant to update it, perhaps confused by the following line in the documentation: 
bq. Go to "JIRA Agile" (not GreenHopper) in the UPM

As I'm not sure what is the actual expected behaviour, I'm filing this as a documentation update - also because updating Greenhopper to JIRA Agile 6.3, from the Available Updates section of the Manage Add-ons page works as expected.
fields.summary: Update the JIRA Agile Upgrade Notes

fields.summary: apostrophes in version names show up as '

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Doing sanity-checking for JIRA 6.1, I did the following steps:

1) Did a clean install of production-mode JIRA 6.1-RC1 BTF on Windows.
2) Followed the JIRA setup process.
3) Clicked Create Project from the dashboard gadget.
4) Selected a JIRA Agile project and followed the prompts to install JIRA Agile.
5) Entered my MAC credentials when instructed.

The installation appear to complete successfully, but when it redirected me back to the Create project dialog, the JIRA Agile project types were missing. Refreshing the page and restarting JIRA Agile did not bring them back.

On closer inspection by [~pobara] and [~jderaedt], it became apparent that JIRA Agile was installed and running but not licensed. Version 6.3.0.2 had been installed. There were no errors in the logs. The license when pasted in manually works.
fields.summary: Installing JIRA Agile from the create project dialog does not licence it

This request is about to have the total hours summed up on per column (TO DO, IN PROGRESS, DONE) as shown on the screenshot attached.

Thanks
fields.summary: Total Hours Summed up on per Column

fields.description: On an agile board, the cell looks to be designed for nearly 4 lines when 3 will likely do. This makes it difficult to view many items at once - a lot of space is wasted.
fields.summary: Agile Board - Cell height is larger than necessary, limits number of cells simultaneously viewed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When using the Agile boards in work mode in scrums that take place with participants in multiple regions, we often need to switch the boards to show swimlanes by assignee, or story, or Epic, in order to visualise progress and focus on blockers.  

This can't be done easily by a quick 'flip' of the swimlane view - we have to go into configuration (and only the board owner can change it) or have two identical boards which differ only by swimlane config (which seems pointless).

Can we have the ability to switch the swimlane mode outside of the config area?  This would be useful and productive in the same way that the quick filters are.
fields.summary: As a ScrumMaster I want to be able to switch swimlane modes quickly in order to support more productive scrums
